Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Mollusc shell
Description: This shell of a marine bivalve mollusc (of the "ostria" type) bears wear marks, especially on the exterior, and is very worn and polished. It still contains a black deposit (possibly kohl), which proves that it was used as a small container for cosmetic paints.
